newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Seoul shares end at 33-month low in thin trade.
newsitem.headline: Seoul shares end at 33-month low in thin trade.

text.p: The South Korean bourse ended at a new 33-month low on Wednesday, dragged down by worries about the economy's health, brokers said.

The composite stock index fell 4.79 points to close provisionally at 789.12. Volume was light, with 17.22 million shares changing hands. This was the lowest close seen since November 11, 1993, when the index ended at 783.35.
"It will be very hard to turn the market around because there's no specific cause. It's more angst about the downturn in the economic cycle," said Joo Sang-soo, a broker at Hanyang Securities.
